ovdesc.p: Property Class that defines through product which channel is allowed.
This Property Class is used by all products which are channel based.
Channels can be replaced or given additional channels at the arrangement level.
Also allows to subscription, de-subscription, and block and unblocks the subscription for a specific period.

Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Date to block the subscription to this channel for a specific period.
Date should be greater than Channel start date.
If multivalued then it should be greater than previous block end date.
Every block periods should be in sequence.
Up to 11 type D (valid date format)
This field is multi value.
Reserved for future use
NOINPUT field.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

No input and multi value field that lists the attributes on the arrangement property record that have been fixed and/or negotiated. These are stored when the arrangement level record is committed. When the arrangement level record is next used all items in the NEGOTIATED.FIELDS list will be maintained
Once an attribute has been fixed or negotiated it will remain in negotiated field list on all subsequent dated versions of the property.
Reserved for future use

If date is not mentioned then it subscribes always

Time to which this Channel will be de-subscribed on the end date.
Up to 15 type T (valid time format)
This field specifies what type of channel to be use. Must be a valid channel on EB.CHANNEL.
For MOBILE.SERVICES product line, only EB.CHANNEL records classified as MOBILE in the CHANNEL.TYPE field will be allowed.
An equivalent mapping of these Mobile records has to define in the properties file for successful Java calls.
Please refer to the ARC Mobile User Guide for more details.
Up to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
Multivalue field.
The code must have a valid entry on the EB.CHANNEL table.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Reserved for future use
NOINPUT field.

No input and multi value field lists all fields that have been negotiated for each dated version of the property. For a subsequently dated property, the attributes listed in this field will appear in "Negotiated.Fields" and only newly negotiated fields will appear on "Changed.Fields"
Optional field - Allowed Values are RESETTING and NON-RESETTING.
RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities (for eg : change.product, rollover or reset) the property conditions will be reset from the product.
NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.
Leaving the field blank sets NON-RESETTING as the default option.
Not used in Arrangement/Sim level.
Contains the name of the property that this arrangement level condition relates to
Name is defined in AA.PRORERTY table
System maintained field no input allowed
The action that caused this arrangement property to be updated.
The action is taken from the underlying AA.ARRANGEMENT.ACTIVITY request that caused the record to be modified
The activity that caused this arrangement property to be updated.
The activity is taken from the underlying AA.ARRANGEMENT.ACTIVITY request that caused the record to be modified
The key to the arrangement property condition. The key is comprised of the following components (delimited by a "-"):
Arrangement Id
Property name>
Effective Date
Date to unblock the blocked Subscription of this channel.
Date should be between the channel subscription period if end date is mentioned.
Up to 11 type D (valid date format)
This field is multi value.
